inputs.name: serverEndpoint
inputs.label: Sonatype Nexus service endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the service endpoint for your Nexus instance.  To create one, click the Manage link and create a new Generic Service Endpoint, enter the Nexus server URL for the server URL, e.g. http://nexusserver.example.com:8080, and required credentials.

inputs.name: groupId
inputs.label: Group Id
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Nexus Group Id.  Only letters, numbers, underscore(_), hyphon(-), and dot(.) are allowed.

inputs.name: artifactId
inputs.label: Artifact Id
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Nexus Artifact Id.  Only letters, numbers, underscore(_), hyphon(-), and dot(.) are allowed.

inputs.name: artifactVersion
inputs.label: Artifact Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Nexus Artifact Version.  Only letters, numbers, underscore(_), hyphon(-), and dot(.) are allowed.

inputs.name: packaging
inputs.label: Packaging
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Nexus Packaging type: pom, jar, ejb, war, ear, rar, par, maven-archetype, or maven-plugin.

inputs.name: classifier
inputs.label: Classifier
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Nexus Classifier of the file to upload. If empty, no classifier will be appended to the file.

inputs.name: extension
inputs.label: Extension
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file extension of the file to upload. If empty, the default file extension (derived from the packaging type) will be used.

inputs.name: trustSSL
inputs.label: Trust Server Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Selecting this option results in the Nexus Server's SSL certificate being trusted even if it is self-signed or cannot be validated by a Certificate Authority (CA).
